did.unittitle: Stanford University, Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Community Center, records
did.abstract: The materials consist of handritten survey forms completed by Stanford students prior to presentations on LGBT issues in student dorms.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: The materials were a gift of Thomas Henning, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the University Archivist, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford University, Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Community Center, Records (SC1065). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of handritten survey forms completed by Stanford students prior to presentations on LGBT issues in student dorms. Questions include: Do you have any gay friends? If a male/female friend of yours told you he/she were gay how would this affect your friendship? Has AIDS affected your attitude toward gay and lesbian people? If your roomate were gay, would you want them to tell you? If you toldyour praents you were gay, how do you think they would react? How would you react if you saw two men/women holding hands in public?
